cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast parallel to the U.S. East Coast, then turning northeast and accelerating past the Mid-Atlantic coast toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (near Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from north of Chincoteague, VA to Fenwick Island, DE and portions of southeastern Massachusetts (Woods Hole–Sagamore Beach, Nantucket, Martha’s Vineyard).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Savannah River, GA to NC/VA border; Tropical-storm warning NC/VA border to Chincoteague, VA and lower Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Georgia through the Carolinas, then offshore Mid-Atlantic and southeastern New England, continuing toward Atlantic Canada.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions with gusts 25-35 mph late Friday night-Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port; surge threat confined to the Carolinas and Tidewater VA.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible; totals generally 1-2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along New York and New Jersey beaches beginning Friday and persisting through Saturday.
